Address.Address1: St\. Sebastian Road, Katukurunda, Kalutara, Bentota

Description.Text: Once you book Premier Garden View room on Breakfast Plan then hotel is offering free upgrade to Deluxe Lagoon view room with dinner on Half Board ( Offer valid till 30th April Stay period )

This luxury hotel in Sri Lanka is located an hour's drive from both the capital Colombo and the Dutch fort of Galle, while being just 10 minutes away from the historic town of Kalutara. This quaint coastal town charms travellers with its rich culture and tropical nature. Step back in time and delve into the island?s spice trading days and colonial heritage of forts, plantations and mansions. Experience the wonder of local handicrafts, sacred temples and the world?s only hollow Buddhist shrine. Cruise the scenic Kalu Ganga, which twists almost 100 miles from Sri Pada - the sacred mountain believed to be the footprint of the Buddha.
Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner are available at this property.
This accommodation has a medium lobby.

RoomType.text: VILLA TWO BEDROOMS WITH PRIVATE POOL

RoomType.text: Double DELUXE OCEAN VIEW + Half Board
Double DELUXE LAGOON VIEW + Half Board
Double Premier Garden View + Half Board

Message.Text:
Room 1
Check in time: 2pmCheck out time: 12pm
Notice
CHECK-IN AND CHECK-OUT TIME Check-in time is 14:00 hrs, an overnight rate will be charged to guarantee check-in before 14:00 hours. Check-out time is 12:00 noon on the day of departure. Late checkout is subject to availability on the day of check out and the following charges will be applied: prior to 18:00 hrs a charge of 50% of the room rate and thereafter a full night charge.


During Religious holidays and Full Moon Poya days in Sri Lanka, alcohol will not be served in public areas at hotels or restaurants. Should you require information on specific dates this affects, please call our Customer Services Team.


Important visa information for Sri Lanka All European visitors to Sri Lanka must have an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) . Whilst it is possible to get an ETA on arrival this can make the immigration process much more lengthy, and we strongly recommend purchasing online before travelling.


All regions of Sri Lanka have experienced some outbreaks of the mosquito-borne dengue fever. Please visit your health professional at least four to six weeks before travel to check whether you require any vaccinations or other preventive measures. Whilst visiting the affected areas visitors should take the necessary steps to avoid being bitten by mosquitoes. For more information please visit https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sri-lanka/health

Notice

CHECK-IN AND CHECK-OUT TIME Check-in time is 14:00 hrs, an overnight rate will be charged to guarantee check-in before 14:00 hours. Check-out time is 12:00 noon on the day of departure. Late checkout is subject to availability on the day of check out and the following charges will be applied: prior to 18:00 hrs a charge of 50% of the room rate and thereafter a full night charge.


During Religious holidays and Full Moon Poya days in Sri Lanka, alcohol will not be served in public areas at hotels or restaurants. Should you require information on specific dates this affects, please call our Customer Services Team.


Important visa information for Sri Lanka All European visitors to Sri Lanka must have an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) . Whilst it is possible to get an ETA on arrival this can make the immigration process much more lengthy, and we strongly recommend purchasing online before travelling.


All regions of Sri Lanka have experienced some outbreaks of the mosquito-borne dengue fever. Please visit your health professional at least four to six weeks before travel to check whether you require any vaccinations or other preventive measures. Whilst visiting the affected areas visitors should take the necessary steps to avoid being bitten by mosquitoes. For more information please visit https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sri-lanka/health
